abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Sustainable
            Employment Development Policy Operation (DPO) Project for
            Kosovo were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was substantial,
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance
            was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: government
            ownership and commitment is necessary for the success of
            budget support operations. In countries with little or no
            experience with budget support operations, the underlying
            policy program should be selective and supervision and
            technical assistance (TA) resources need to be dedicated to
            support implementation of the reforms, especially in the
            areas where capacity is low. In post-conflict countries,
            where capacity is weak, development policy operations can be
            effective instruments when accompanied by a critical mass of
            technical assistance. Identifying good indicators to
            evaluate progress in a short-term DPO can be difficult,
            especially in countries with scarce data and limited
            capacity. Coordinating a multi-donor trust fund is
            time-consuming and costly but can sustain a consolidated and
            impactful operation.
